MTL_240.question: At what time does the hiker in a blue cap talk about having taken the wrong track (a “slight boo-boo”) and mention stopping by a war memorial and church, while we briefly see a graveyard and ambient electronic music starts?

MTL_214.question: At what time does the host introduce it as a special Red Fox Outdoors video about a bushcrafty tarp tent, followed by a whooshing sound and a thunder-like effect while the screen shows “Welcome” and then “Redfox Outdoors”?

MTL_476.question: Identify the time segment where on-screen text reads "GROWTH FACTORS: INSULIN, IGF-1, MECHANICAL STIMULI," followed by a pathway diagram (insulin/IGF-1/leucine → PKB/Akt → mTOR → p70S6K, 4E-BP1) while the speaker explains these signals inhibit autophagy by promoting muscle protein synthesis.

MTL_271.question: At what time does the video first show a posted warning sign that says not to approach or feed mountain goats on a snowy mountain, while the hiker says, “Today is not the day to get gored or butted down a mountain,” with heavy breathing and wind, and later a male voice says, “He’s coming”?

MTL_350.question: When do the on-screen Japanese captions state that the incident began when President Macron announced a gasoline price hike and that it started as normal protests saying “No,” while the audio describes anger about rising gas prices, taxes, and feeling unheard?

MTL_798.question: Locate the moment when the speaker explains that another way to access the textbook is to download a PDF—which will open in any PDF viewer and is just as complete as the online version—while on-screen the user goes to Book details, encounters a support pop-up, clicks “Give today,” and the PDF opens to the blue “Astronomy” cover page. When does this occur?

MTL_783.question: When does the screen show a blue circle labeled "MASS" alongside a "LIKE THE VIDEO!" button, while the narrator transitions from discussing gravity in Gs to stating that gravity depends on mass?

MTL_283.question: Locate the moment when a shaggy brown Highland cow stands by a moss-covered tree with its mouth slightly open, while the speaker corrects themselves saying, "...not sheep, cows, I mean." Which time segment is this?

MTL_30.question: When do we see the speaker in a National Geographic gallery setting (including shots of him in front of an underwater elephant image and a banner reading “National Geographic Fine Art Series”) while we hear him describe his parents’ scientific work—his father, an organic chemist educated at Cambridge and MIT who helped invent Taxol for breast and ovarian cancer, and his mother, an analytical chemist who helped invent the magenta dye used in Polaroids—ending with a joke about there being “no expectations” to be a scientist?

MTL_474.question: At what time does the video show energetic dancers (a man in a white suit and a woman in a red dress) followed by visuals of atmospheric molecules and a sky with yellow particles, while the narrator cites a Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society literature survey by three climatologists that found seven papers predicting global cooling but more predicting warming, explaining the cooling was due to pollution?

MTL_4.question: Locate the segment where, while the camera shows model tank images with the on-screen text "M4A3E8 Sherman 'Easy Eight' Platoon," the speakers excitedly point out a "new plastic M4 A3 E8," say the commander looks like someone from a movie, and mention its suitability for World War Two and the Korean War.

MTL_280.question: During which time is the hiker walking a fern-lined path while explaining that there’s a hostel where young people stay to explore the beautiful Blackdown Hills and describing how fake airplanes and lights were used during World War II to fool the Germans?

MTL_90.question: Locate the moment where a split-screen shows the host on the left and, on the right, a different individual in a white sports jersey with a distinctive hairstyle, while an on-screen tweet from 'United Journal' quotes Erik ten Hag on mentality ('It starts with yourself. Follow the rules and principles and work hard. If you do that, you will get confidence.'). At the same time, the speaker audibly quotes Ten Hag and adds, "if this signing doesn't fill you with a bit of confidence, then I don't know what signing will." Which time segment is this?

MTL_529.question: At what time does the person light a fuse on the pine‑needle-covered ground while saying it’s a “standard issue American one and a half inch firecracker,” which is followed by a loud explosion and his comment that it was a “bad little bang”?

MTL_379.question: When does the video show a cluttered bed with bags of bread, white corn, and pasta secured with binder clips while the speaker explains that a large sourdough loaf doesn’t fit in the cabinets, so he moves food between the bed by day and the counter at night, also mentioning needing many blankets, limited headroom, and a sleeping bag hung up?

MTL_653.question: When does the presenter introduce a prompt showing wildfires in the mountains and note a border forming, then identify the artwork as Julian Calor’s “No Fear Anymore,” matching the on‑screen cover with a hand reaching toward fiery light?

MTL_321.question: At what time does the man quote an immigration officer saying “I don’t trust West Africans,” prompting the woman to respond, “Wow, I was shocked,” while he gestures animatedly during their seated conversation?

MTL_37.question: At what time does the footage cut to satellite dishes in extreme environments (a large white dish in snowy mountains, a person in a red jacket near a blue building with a dish, and dishes under a starry sky and in a desert) while the speaker explains that, when searching for technosignatures, they are trying to detect "RFI from space," expecting narrowband signals that must repeat?

MTL_818.question: During which time segment does the video show a split-screen with a video game crafting interface (e.g., an item like a “Padded Fur Hood” and a username at the top) alongside a Creamy Poblano Mac & Cheese recipe and a humorous burnt bread image, while the speakers discuss scaling the recipe and conclude that all ingredients—not just the cheese—must be doubled for ten people?

MTL_123.question: When do the hosts shift into a comedic bit about bats—saying a bat must fall to fly, declaring “Sting is now a bat” who “did not jump through these tables; he fell”—while the visuals rapidly cut between unusual scenes like a man in a red hoodie reading a comic on the grass and a person in a black outfit with large wings on a balcony, and then segue into an upbeat ad read?

MTL_501.question: Identify the time segment where a diapered baby is shown while a syringe approaches, on-screen text contrasts about 10 antigens in the syringe with 80,000 in the baby, and the narrator says there’s “more challenge to their immune system in their diaper than the syringe.”

MTL_723.question: When does the video show a small central square that switches to display the text "PlayStation VR," followed by a grayscale landscape with floating round objects, while a male narrator explains somatic cells, chromosomes, diploid organisms, and haploid gametes in relation to parental inheritance?

MTL_284.question: At what time does the woman point out the on-screen website 'www.montourdumontblanc.com' while verbally explaining they used that site for planning and saying they'll put the link in the description?

MTL_417.question: Identify the time segment where the doctor, in blue scrubs on a plain white background, discusses diagnostic methods for ringworm—specifically visual diagnosis, skin scraping under a microscope, KOH mount, culture, and biopsy—while on-screen text highlights tests for diagnosing and prompts to subscribe to Dr. Education channels.
MTL_417.model_reason: because the doctor is speaking in a foreign language and there are captions under the video that provide additional information.

MTL_577.question: When is the stream already ON AIR with the Warzone title screen visible (overhead view, “Press to start”), a face-cam overlay present, and the speaker advising to log into Twitch on a separate device to handle chat, all while dramatic, ominous background music plays?

MTL_605.question: Locate the segment where two men are seated on a University of Otago stage before an audience, as the interviewer asks whether National will reach 48–50 percent, the respondent answers he hopes not and notes no party has topped 50 percent since 1951, clarifies his roughly 10,000 majority was from a by-election, and the exchange ends with the interviewer thanking him and audible applause.

MTL_855.question: When does the video show a molecular model of NaCl dissolving in water (water molecules surrounding Na+ and Cl−) while the narrator explains modeling dissolution as reactions and predicting the equilibrium constant from the Gibbs energy change?

MTL_850.question: When does the grid whiteboard show the finalized rate law Rate = k[H2]^1[Cl2]^2 while the speaker says he is plugging experiment one’s data into the rate law—explicitly citing [H2] = 0.001 M, [Cl2] = 0.001 M, and rate = 2.1×10^-4 M/s—to compute k and discuss the units?

MTL_122.question: Identify when the speaker highlights his go-to batting gloves—the True Diamond Science gloves with a palm pad—while close-up visuals show white gloves with “TRUE” branding on the grass, and he also mentions rotating two pairs and carrying a Pro Hitter thumb guard.

MTL_718.question: When does the screen show the definition of “Dehydration Synthesis” along with a triglyceride model and a chemical reaction diagram, while the speaker explains building a triglyceride (glycerol head, fatty acid tails with a carboxyl group) and says an enzyme removes atoms from the glycerol’s hydroxyl group?

MTL_591.question: At what time do we see the Lately Social interface creating a scheduled Instagram post (showing 14/2/2020 03:36 AM with tags like “Trip” and “#landscape”) while the narrator enthusiastically describes a paid tool that handles video uploads, scheduling, stories, carousels, IGTV (and soon Reels) and mentions a discount link for serious users?

MTL_640.question: Identify the time segment when the anchor asks about QE3 and more monetary stimulus, and the speaker argues it would devalue the dollar and hurt the middle class—saying wealth shifts to the wealthy, referencing QE1 and QE2, and insisting wealth isn’t created by “monetary units out of a computer”—while on-screen captions read “MORE STIMULUS HURTS THE DOLLAR” and “MIDDLE CLASS HURT BY WEAK DOLLAR.”

MTL_340.question: When do we see the man standing in the autumn forest while he greets, “Good morning,” and says he slept well? Choose the exact time segment matching both the outdoor visual and that specific greeting.

MTL_500.question: During the moment when the screen asks “Is the antigen load increasing?” alongside a yellow sticky note reading “Too Many Too Soon” and a tweet from Donald J. Trump, and the narrator answers, “No, in fact, it has decreased substantially since 1960,” explaining changes like removal of smallpox and pertussis vaccine shifts, which time segment does this occur in?

MTL_684.question: During which time segment does the video show a blue background diagram of a circle with radius r and a green dot with a tangential velocity arrow V, while a male instructor explains period and frequency and the audio ends with the distinct sound of a cow?

MTL_422.question: Identify the segment where the on-screen text reads “Lateral (Sims) Position” as staff adjust the patient on the bed, with one holding a remote, while the narrator discusses the lateral/Sims position and its applications in renal and cardiothoracic surgeries, framed by brief electronic music transitions.

MTL_406.question: In the segment where the hand performs Gauss-Jordan elimination on an augmented matrix while the speaker says "Time to flex that matrix muscle," describes row operations like "multiply row two by five," notes that all entries are even and suggests multiplying every row by one half, and a whoosh sound closes the clip—when does this occur?

MTL_747.question: When does the footage switch between infrared and visible views of a nebula—with the on-screen tags “Infrared” and later “Visible” in the corner—while the narrator explains that Hubble studies the birth, life, and death of stars and can peer through thick clouds in star-forming regions?

MTL_524.question: At what time does the presenter mention “hybrid solutions” (noting they’re typical in naval radars), a burst of electronic sounds is heard, and he then highlights the drawback called “scan loss,” with the on-screen text “Scan Loss” appearing while footage shows several fighter jets lined up on a runway?

MTL_300.question: When does the hiker, over visuals of rural warning signs like “Danger/Keep Off” and “Electric Fence,” sheep in a field, and an older man driving a green tractor, remark about a farmer’s ingenuity securing a gate and then ask a local named Michael if he was born nearby (who replies yes), with light folk music in the background?

MTL_157.question: When does the show kick off the “Employee of the Week” segment, featuring a playful spring sound followed by triumphant, brass-heavy music, as the on-screen text reads “Weekly Dumb JOMBOY Media Employee of the Week”?

MTL_676.question: When does the static diffraction diagram appear while the narrator explains you can hear someone near a doorway because the wave spreads out and diffracts around the opening?

MTL_689.question: When does the instructor, in front of a whiteboard packed with equations, explicitly say “V squared equals mu s g r” and “V equals the square root of mu s g r,” then mentions plugging in 0.4, 9.8 newtons per kilogram, and 57 meters?

MTL_695.question: When does the speaker reference an MRI by saying he has shown a computer map of the magnetic field inside an MRI solenoid, while the screen displays a colorful, heat map-like visualization of a cylindrical object with a color scale labeled from 0 to 100 on the right?

MTL_230.question: When do we see the opening close-up of a shovel digging as on-screen text reads “Balxies Gold Adventures, Anzac Day Weekend,” while the narrator greets listeners on Anzac Day weekend and talks about looking for “flower gold” and preferring crevices?

MTL_581.question: When does the shortcut creation dialog show the user navigating to the USB drive to pick Kodi.exe (with a “New Shortcut” on the desktop and the path like E:\Kodi\Kodi.exe) while the narrator instructs to add “space then dash P” to make it portable and says “click next and create”?

MTL_805.question: At what time does the presenter in a green-and-black checkered shirt show a graph comparing Greek vs Indian solar prediction errors (annotated with years like "100 AD" and "2020") while stating that the Indian technique is twice as accurate as the Greek one?

MTL_362.question: When do we see the lively arena scene with the group mingling—handshakes, kids in white hoodies, and a visible "LET'S GO" sign—while we hear someone challenge a companion to "name one player on either team," get "Ben Wallace" as the answer, joke it’s a "two out of ten," along with a playful "I believe I can fly" singing and hyped crowd reactions?

MTL_758.question: At what time does the screen show a Twitter post by Christian Froeschlin featuring Jupiter with the Great Red Spot, while the narrator talks about a “curious feature” at a similar latitude to the Great Red Spot that they’ve been tracking for a few days? Choose the exact time segment.
MTL_758.model_reason: Christian Froeschlin posted a tweet at 00:05:13, which is within 1 hour and 13 minutes of the Great Red Spot.

MTL_79.question: When do we see a lab machine and a press conference with Dr. Bonnie Henry after on-screen text about trying for a second baby, while the audio briefly announces “another case of COVID-19” before returning to how the Sussexes bonded during the pandemic?

MTL_822.question: Identify the time segment where the narrator talks about precipitation from clouds dissolving minerals to make salty oceans, includes a brief interjection of “Hi,” and the visuals transition from a salt-water ion cluster to a white “Forming ions” slide showing Na losing an electron and Cl gaining one. Choose the exact segment.

MTL_755.question: At what time does the presenter point to an “Ecliptic Obliquity” diagram and the screen later shows the texts “7300–7800 BC” and “23.44°,” while he audibly claims a thesis matched Surya Siddhanta’s latitudinal data to 7300–7800 BC and discusses changes in Earth’s obliquity?

MTL_72.question: At what time does the segment occur where a different woman in a blue dress, seated on a red chair with on-screen "Outro"/"Thanks For Watchi" text, discusses a "gentleman's upstairs breast" (pecs), debating whether Chris Evans has "man boobs" or a firm, enormous chest?
MTL_72.model_reason: the "Outro"/"Thanks For Watchi" text is shown between 00:00:00 and 00:00:36

MTL_389.question: At what time does the officer in a light uniform stand commandingly by the chessboard and mountain-view window while denouncing English “weakness and decadence,” boasting about “primitive virtues” and “destroying to create a new world,” prompting the seated man to reply, “God help it,” followed by a dissonant sting?

MTL_298.question: When is the detectorist kneeling in a grassy park by a lake and mountains, using an orange pinpointer on a small dirt plug, while saying he’s getting a “78 signal,” that it could be a ring but likely not gold, and noting he’s right next to the edge of the water?

MTL_198.question: Identify the time segment where a toaster image with two slices popping up appears on screen while a male speaker brags about being a “real toast master,” contrasting others who take forever to heat their bagel, and the audio ends with a dramatic sting followed by a toaster pop sound.

MTL_251.question: At what time do we see a close-up of an outdoor skills book by Ellsworth Jaeger followed by the man working at an outdoor table, while the audio features a lighter sparking and the speaker saying “There we go”?

MTL_765.question: When do walkers pass the “Scale Model of Our Solar System” sign for Saturn while voices say “To the rings,” react to “They made rings,” mention “31 known moons,” point out “You are here,” and joke about “Uranus or Uranus”?
MTL_765.model_reason: The reason for this is because the walkers are shown to be in the presence of the 31 known moons of Saturn, and also, the sign mentions Uranus and the walkers are passing through Uranus.

MTL_629.question: Identify when the speaker explains that Bobby had been considering retirement but agreed to stay to finish several long‑term projects, while speaking from the Governor of South Carolina podium with the U.S. and South Carolina flags behind him in a formal room with wooden paneling and a stained glass window.

MTL_771.question: At what time does the video cut to an animation of Earth with a grid and white rotation arrows, a red arrow pointing to the North Pole, and an orbital path, while the narrator explains precession—saying the rotation axis changes its tilt and that it’s not always 23.3 degrees—as part of why Polaris doesn’t stay exactly in the same place?

Unbelievable!” while the visuals show Kyle Sherman in a blue jersey making a critical shot under a “Semifinals - Race to 2 Points” scoreboard, followed by red-jersey players celebrating?

MTL_217.question: During which time segment does the presenter, beside a black Toyota 4Runner with a roof solar array, show a close-up of a portable power station while saying it’s around 10:25 and he’s getting “165 watts going in,” noting he saw “221 watts” the previous day?

MTL_55.question: Identify the exact time segment where, during a live C‑SPAN State Dinner broadcast labeled “Guest Arrivals,” Frank Ocean (in a dark suit) speaks with a woman holding a microphone/notepad and says he’ll ask Obama if he had fun these last eight years and that he never saw himself at a state dinner.

MTL_729.question: During which time segment does the screen show “Figure 2.12” comparing palmitic acid and linoleic acid with space-filling models, while the narrator explains that hydrogens are on every carbon in the saturated molecule leaving “no room for movement,” and contrasts this with linoleic acid’s double bonds that let it flow more easily?

MTL_184.question: When does the screen display a brain diagram with colored sections labeled in Chinese while the speaker discusses using humor to ease mistakes, says seventh grade is a pivotal point when students take responsibility, and notes that by eighth grade they may think they’ve gotten cool and be less receptive?

MTL_63.question: Locate the segment where a man with long dreadlocks, tattoos, and a black tank top appears against a dark background while the narrator says Waka Flocka Flame quit a plant-based lifestyle, complained other vegans acted like "the cops," and disliked how calling himself "vegan" made him sound superior.

MTL_277.question: When does the video show a sign about a 3.1-mile walk on Rt 98 while the hiker says the roadwalk has ended, there’s no trail but markers are visible, and he must carve his own path in the heat, slowing down?

MTL_583.question: At what time does the screen show the AT&T router’s Firewall sections (including “Applications, Pinholes and DMZ”) and Wi‑Fi configuration pages while the narrator instructs to select a device/IP for the home router, save, then go to the LAN > WiFi sub‑tab and disable both the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Wi‑Fi networks?

MTL_436.question: During what time interval does the video show the French Café labeled with a "QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH" banner, a clipboard marked "QUESTIONNAIRE," the word "EXPERIMENT" alongside a cupcake tagged "NEW," and on audio the narrator introduces several quantitative methods (questionnaire, experiments like counting how many new cakes sold, observation/online booking) and explicitly says they could also use Google Analytics, concluding "we call this type of research quantitative research"?

MTL_697.question: Identify when the slide states that, because electrons are charged, an accelerating electron would emit light and lose energy—spiraling into the nucleus (the flaw of the Planetary model)—while the speaker introduces the Bohr atomic model and says electrons have wave-like properties, with a diagram labeled “de Broglie electron wave.”

MTL_51.question: Identify the time segment where a comic-book style image of a muscular man in a red suit with lightning is shown while the speaker criticizes a variant cover as inappropriate for children, saying “let’s not do this” and mentioning a “half naked” person on the cover.

MTL_566.question: During which segment is the presenter holding a power drill in the workshop while explaining that affiliate links help support the channel and don’t cost viewers anything extra?

MTL_726.question: At what time segment does the video show the Activity slide with three colored instruction boxes (orange, brown, purple) about cutting a hibiscus flower longitudinally, while the narrator instructs to cut from the base along the carpel to the stigma, warns not to destroy other floral parts, and concludes with “Now this is what you see”?

MTL_205.question: When does he hold a “Mosquito Shield” mosquito coils package labeled with a citronella scent and explain that the small amount of smoke seems to work well on mosquitoes at camp, while saying he’s unsure about deerflies?

MTL_487.question: During which time segment do we see star trails circling around Polaris with on-screen text like "Evidence of Revolution: Star Trails," while the narrator explains that star trails are circular traces caused by Earth's rotation and uses a spinning-in-a-room analogy?

MTL_811.question: At what time does the video show a close-up of a camera screen cycling through movie recording sizes (e.g., 1920x1080, 1280x720, 640x480) while the speaker explains that an old Canon DSLR has a special crop mode ideal for planetary imaging, describing how he frames in normal modes and then switches to crop for a short recording?

MTL_108.question: Identify the segment where an on-screen quote reads “Coach, I don’t want to do this” over footage of a tense late-game scoreboard (SAC 105 – WSH 102, 23.6s left) with “BROWN” #5 visible, while the narrator quotes Kwame Brown saying the night before being drafted he didn’t want to do it and wasn’t ready for the expectations.

MTL_258.question: At what time does the segment occur where aerial shots of a river appear with on‑screen text about “How to cross a river safely” and arrows pointing to a wide, braided crossing point, while the audio explains there are no bridges, suggests moving about 150 yards to a river curve, and tells you to “read the river”?

MTL_131.question: When does the segment show the “24 different injuries” montage (including a yellow-jersey player receiving medical attention, talking with a coach wearing an “Evonik Industries” logo, and a person on crutches with a knee brace) while the narrator says another Barcelona midfielder in the same position has been injured at least 24 times and that “every time Gundo came back, he came back better”?
